Description détaillée
Base class for all commands.
Auteur
Fabien Potencier fabien@symfony.com
Documentation des constructeurs et destructeur

__construct (string $name = null )
Paramètres
string | null$name
The name of the command; passing null means it must be set in configure()
Exceptions
LogicException
When the command name is empty

Documentation des fonctions membres
addArgument() addArgumentCommand CommandaddArgument
addArgument (string $name, int $mode = null , string $description = '' , $default = null )
Adds an argument.
Paramètres
int | null$mode
The argument mode: InputArgument::REQUIRED or InputArgument::OPTIONAL
mixed$default
The default value (for InputArgument::OPTIONAL mode only)
Renvoie
$this
Exceptions
InvalidArgumentException
When argument mode is not valid
Réimplémentée dans LazyCommand. Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
addOption() addOptionCommand CommandaddOption
addOption (string $name, $shortcut = null , int $mode = null , string $description = '' , $default = null )
Adds an option.
Paramètres
string | array | null$shortcut
The shortcuts, can be null, a string of shortcuts delimited by | or an array of shortcuts
int | null$mode
The option mode: One of the InputOption::VALUE_* constants
mixed$default
The default value (must be null for InputOption::VALUE_NONE)
Renvoie
$this
Exceptions
InvalidArgumentException
If option mode is invalid or incompatible
Réimplémentée dans LazyCommand. Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :

Add a command usage example, it'll be prefixed with the command name.
Renvoie
$this

complete() completeCommand Commandcomplete
complete (CompletionInput $input, CompletionSuggestions $suggestions)
Adds suggestions to $suggestions for the current completion input (e.g. option or argument).
Réimplémentée dans DumpCompletionCommand, HelpCommand, LazyCommand, et ListCommand.
configure() configureCommand Commandconfigure
configure ( )[protected]
Configures the current command.
Réimplémentée dans CleanSoftwareCommand, CompileScssCommand, ClearCommand, ConfigureCommand, DebugCommand, SetNamespacePrefixCommand, SetCommand, AbstractConfigureCommand, CheckSchemaIntegrityCommand, ConfigureCommand, EnableTimezonesCommand, InstallCommand, UpdateCommand, CheckDocumentsIntegrityCommand, CheckHtmlEncodingCommand, DisableMaintenanceModeCommand, EnableMaintenanceModeCommand, DownloadCommand, InfoCommand, SearchCommand, AbstractPluginToCoreCommand, AppliancesPluginToCoreCommand, BuildMissingTimestampsCommand, DatabasesPluginToCoreCommand, DomainsPluginToCoreCommand, DynamicRowFormatCommand, MigrateAllCommand, MyIsamToInnoDbCommand, RacksPluginToCoreCommand, TimestampsCommand, UnsignedKeysCommand, Utf8mb4Command, AbstractPluginCommand, ActivateCommand, DeactivateCommand, InstallCommand, UninstallCommand, ProcessSoftwareCategoryRulesCommand, ReplayDictionnaryRulesCommand, ChangekeyCommand, CheckRequirementsCommand, CheckStatusCommand, ListServicesCommand, UnlockCommand, CompleteCommand, DumpCompletionCommand, HelpCommand, ListCommand, AddFileCommand, BaseArchiveCommand, BaseFileCommand, CommentCommand, CreateCommand, DeleteFileCommand, DetailsCommand, DriversCommand, ExtractArchiveCommand, ExtractFileCommand, ExtractFilesCommand, FoldersCommand, FormatCommand, FormatsCommand, InfoCommand, ListCommand, PrintCommand, TableCommand, TestCommand, et TypesCommand. Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
execute() executeCommand Commandexecute
execute (InputInterface $input, OutputInterface $output)[protected]
Executes the current command.
This method is not abstract because you can use this class as a concrete class. In this case, instead of defining the execute() method, you set the code to execute by passing a Closure to the setCode() method.
Renvoie
int 0 if everything went fine, or an exit code
Exceptions
LogicException
When this abstract method is not implemented
Voir également
setCode()
Réimplémentée dans CleanSoftwareCommand, ClearCommand, ConfigureCommand, DebugCommand, SetNamespacePrefixCommand, SetCommand, ConfigureCommand, EnableTimezonesCommand, CheckDocumentsIntegrityCommand, CheckHtmlEncodingCommand, DisableMaintenanceModeCommand, DownloadCommand, InfoCommand, AbstractPluginToCoreCommand, AppliancesPluginToCoreCommand, BuildMissingTimestampsCommand, DynamicRowFormatCommand, MigrateAllCommand, MyIsamToInnoDbCommand, RacksPluginToCoreCommand, TimestampsCommand, UnsignedKeysCommand, Utf8mb4Command, ActivateCommand, DeactivateCommand, InstallCommand, UninstallCommand, ProcessSoftwareCategoryRulesCommand, ReplayDictionnaryRulesCommand, ChangekeyCommand, CheckRequirementsCommand, CheckStatusCommand, ListServicesCommand, UnlockCommand, DumpCompletionCommand, HelpCommand, ListCommand, AddFileCommand, CommentCommand, CreateCommand, DetailsCommand, ExtractArchiveCommand, ExtractFileCommand, ExtractFilesCommand, FoldersCommand, InfoCommand, ListCommand, TableCommand, TestCommand, et TypesCommand. getNativeDefinition() getNativeDefinitionCommand CommandgetNativeDefinition
getNativeDefinition ( )
Gets the InputDefinition to be used to create representations of this Command.
Can be overridden to provide the original command representation when it would otherwise be changed by merging with the application InputDefinition.
This method is not part of public API and should not be used directly.
Renvoie
InputDefinition
Réimplémentée dans LazyCommand. Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :

getProcessedHelp ( )
Returns the processed help for the command replacing the command.name% and command.full_name% patterns with the real values dynamically.
Renvoie
string

ignoreValidationErrors() ignoreValidationErrorsCommand CommandignoreValidationErrors
ignoreValidationErrors ( )
Ignores validation errors.
This is mainly useful for the help command.
Réimplémentée dans LazyCommand. Voici le graphe d'appel pour cette fonction :
Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
initialize() initializeCommand Commandinitialize
initialize (InputInterface $input, OutputInterface $output)[protected]
Initializes the command after the input has been bound and before the input is validated.
This is mainly useful when a lot of commands extends one main command where some things need to be initialized based on the input arguments and options.
Voir également
InputInterface::bind()
InputInterface::validate()
Réimplémentée dans AbstractCommand, CompileScssCommand, AbstractPluginToCoreCommand, et CompleteCommand. Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
interact() interactCommand Commandinteract
interact (InputInterface $input, OutputInterface $output)[protected]
Interacts with the user.
This method is executed before the InputDefinition is validated. This means that this is the only place where the command can interactively ask for values of missing required arguments. Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
isEnabled() isEnabledCommand CommandisEnabled
isEnabled ( )
Checks whether the command is enabled or not in the current environment.
Override this to check for x or y and return false if the command cannot run properly under the current conditions.
Renvoie
bool
Réimplémentée dans LazyCommand. Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :

isHidden ( )
Renvoie
bool whether the command should be publicly shown or not

mergeApplicationDefinition() mergeApplicationDefinitionCommand CommandmergeApplicationDefinition
mergeApplicationDefinition (bool $mergeArgs = true )
Merges the application definition with the command definition.
This method is not part of public API and should not be used directly.
Paramètres
bool$mergeArgs
Whether to merge or not the Application definition arguments to Command definition arguments
Réimplémentée dans LazyCommand. Voici le graphe des appelants de cette fonction :
run() runCommand Commandrun
run (InputInterface $input, OutputInterface $output)
Runs the command.
The code to execute is either defined directly with the setCode() method or by overriding the execute() method in a sub-class.
Renvoie
int The command exit code
Exceptions
ExceptionInterface
When input binding fails. Bypass this by calling ignoreValidationErrors().
Voir également
setCode()
execute()

setCode() setCodeCommand CommandsetCode
setCode (callable $code)
Sets the code to execute when running this command.
If this method is used, it overrides the code defined in the execute() method.
Paramètres
callable$code
A callable(InputInterface $input, OutputInterface $output)
Renvoie
$this
Exceptions
InvalidArgumentException
Voir également

setName() setNameCommand CommandsetName

Sets the name of the command.
This method can set both the namespace and the name if you separate them by a colon (:) $command->setName('foo:bar'); Renvoie
